### Step 1: Check and Reseat Your SIM Card (Common Roaming Fix)
A loose SIM or recognition issue can cause no signal, especially after travel or restarts.
- Power off your phone.
- Remove the SIM card tray (use the ejector tool or paperclipâ€”usually on the side of the phone).
- Take out the SIM card, wipe it gently with a soft cloth (no liquids), and check for damage (e.g., bent corners).
- Reinsert it firmly, ensuring it's seated properly (gold contacts facing down).
- Power on the phone.
- Go to Settings > About Phone > Status (or SIM Status) to check if it shows "SIM Active" or similar. If it says "Missing" or "Locked," let me know the exact message.
- After reinserting, wait 2-3 minutes for roaming to register. Do you see signal now?

If the SIM shows as "Locked" (e.g., PIN or PUK), you'll need your SIM PIN (default is often 0000 or 1234â€”check your phone's original packaging or account notes). If it's PUK-locked (after too many wrong PIN tries), reply with that, and we'll escalate for a unlock code.

### Step 2: Optimize Network Mode (Switch to 4G/5G for Better Roaming)
Older modes like 2G/3G can fail to connect abroad.
- Go to Settings > Network & Internet (or Connections) > Mobile Network > Preferred Network Type (or Advanced Network Settings).
- Select "4G/5G Preferred," "LTE/5G Auto," or "Global" (avoid 2G/3G only).
- Save changes, then toggle Airplane Mode on for 10 seconds and off (this forces a network search).
- Wait 1-2 minutes. Any signal bars appear? Try a test call or text (non-MMS) to confirm service.

### Step 3: Reset APN Settings (Fixes Connectivity for Roaming/MMS)
This is a top fix for no signal or MMS failures abroad, as roaming can mess up network configs.
- Go to Settings > Network & Internet > Mobile Network > Access Point Names (APN).
- Tap the menu (three dots) and select "Reset to Default" (this clears any custom or corrupted settings).

  - MMSC: http://mmsc.[Your Carrier].com (for MMS)
  - Leave other fields blank, MCC/MNC as auto.
- Save, select it as the active APN.
- Restart your phone.
- After reboot, check for signal and try mobile data (toggle it off/on). Then test a simple web page load (e.g., google.com) to confirm data works.

### Quick Note on Your Data Usage
I checked your accountâ€”your plan has a 15 GB monthly limit, and you've used about 15.1 GB this cycle. Hang in thereâ€”this is usually resolved by SIM reseat or APN reset while roaming. If no signal after these, we may need to check for partner network issues in your area or escalate to our roaming support team. Let me know how it goes!
